title.narrative: OUTPUT 4.1: Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH)

description.narrative: Output 4.1 Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH): Regional and national stakeholders have increased evidence, capacity to develop and monitor policies and programmes that address equitable access to safe and sustainable drinking water, sanitation and hygiene services in communities, including resilience to climate change, in urban settings and in fragile and humanitarian contexts., which contributes to Children In Urban Settings / Local Governance, Disaster Risk Reduction, Environmental Sustainability, Sanitation, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: New Element

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 4.1 WASH: Regional and national stakeholders have increased evidence, capacity to develop and monitor policies andprogrammes that address equitable access to safe and sustainable drinking water, sanitation and hygiene services in communities,including resilience to climate change, in urban settings and in fragile and humanitarian contexts.

description.narrative: Guided by various frameworks, strategies and guidance (UNICEF WASH strategy, GWC SP2016-2020, COVID-19 guidance, HH4A...) and through a regional PCA withSIWIand as co-lead of the WASH-LAC Group and R4V WASH Group, LACRO provided support to 24 COs/40 countries to strengthen the sector capacities to develop, fund and monitor WASH policies/programmes that bridge WASH services inequality gaps and to respond to COVID-19 and migration crisis and another 7 emergencies. As a result, WASH capacity increased, quality and coherence of the programming was enhanced with UNICEF being a stronger convener and partner of choice for sector governance at regional/national levels. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:04/03/2022
